thread.title: Polls open for Exeter's St Leonard's and Newtown by-election

author: Jamie Hawkins
title: Polls open for Exeter's St Leonard's and Newtown by-election
text:
The polling station at St Luke's Campus Share Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The polls are open for today’s Exeter City Council by-election for Newtown and St Leonard’s. 
It comes at a tricky time for the Exeter branch of the Labour Party, which fought the last election on its flagship city centre pool and bus station plan – one which now faces an uncertain future after Crown Estates pulled out of the development, as well as the sudden resignation of Roger Spackman, who faces an allegation of downloading child porn . 
There are three city council seats in each of the city’s wards. 
Likely to retain the relatively safe seat for Labour is Matthew Vizard, husband to Natalie Vizard, who won her seat in the ward comfortably last year. An Arsenal supporter, Mr Vizard is a stalwart member of the local Labour Party who has been pounding the pavements of his prospective ward and having ‘excellent conversations’ with residents. Read More The great Rizla shortage: Exeter tobacconist reveals boom in business as supermarkets suffer 
The Conservative Party’s Lucille Baker will be hoping to build on her party’s second-place performance in last year’s election, and given the bus station and swimming pool debacle, plus the cloud under which Labour’s Roger Spackman left, she is optimistic of doing just that. 
UKIP will be represented by Alison Sheridan, of Pinhoe. Alison has been busy canvassing the area and with Brexit high on the agenda will hope to improve on the 172 and 104 votes her party's candidates received at the 2016 poll. Alison has three young children, several rescue animals including three ex battery hens and a very understanding husband. She says she is passionate about helping the most vulnerable in society and keen to listen and get active in the ward. Alison Sheridan, UKIP's candidate 
Representing the Green Party is Tom Milburn. He has lived in the city centre for 20 years, having first come to Exeter as a student. He is highly critical of the proliferation of luxury student flats in Exeter and of the £5million spent on developing the bus station site. Tom Milburn 
Lib Dem stalwart Vanessa Newcombe will be attempting to wrest the seat from Labour for her party but faces an uphill battle, Lib Dem James Landymore netted just 244 votes in the 2016 poll, while Spackman, who now faces an allegation of downloading child porn, received 1,448 votes. Read More
